div.p: An Inequality on the Edge Lengths of Triangular Meshes

For any two triangular meshes A and B of the same polygon C, if the number of vertices in A is at most the number of vertices in B, then the maximum length of an edge in A is at least the minimum distance between two vertices in B.
Most previous algorithms for mesh generation either maximize the minimum angle or minimize the maximum angle of a triangular mesh.
The triangular meshes generated by such algorithms bounded maximum-to-minimum angle ratios, but not bounded maximumto-minimum edge length ratios.
